content.question: What is Palma Wallet?
content.answer: Palma Wallet is a cryptocurrency wallet application that allows users to securely store, send, and receive digital assets. It focuses on providing a user-friendly interface while maintaining robust security for cryptocurrency transactions.

content.question: Which cryptocurrencies does Palma Wallet support?
content.answer: Palma Wallet currently supports USDT (Tether) on both ERC20 (Ethereum) and TRC20 (TRON) networks. It also supports USDC (USD Coin) on the ERC20 network. Support for additional cryptocurrencies is planned for future updates.

content.question: Is Palma Wallet free to use?
content.answer: Palma Wallet is free to download and use. There are no fees charged by the wallet itself for basic operations. However, blockchain transaction fees (network fees) apply when sending cryptocurrencies, which vary depending on the network used (ERC20 or TRC20).

content.question: How do I create a Palma Wallet account?
content.answer: You can create a Palma Wallet account by signing in with Google, Apple, or phone verification. After authentication, a secure cryptographic key pair is generated for your wallet to ensure transaction security.

content.question: What authentication methods does Palma Wallet support?
content.answer: Palma Wallet supports three authentication methods: Google Sign-In, Apple Sign-In, and phone number verification. These provide secure and convenient ways to access your wallet.

content.question: How does Palma Wallet ensure the security of my account?
content.answer: Palma Wallet implements several security measures including: generating cryptographic key pairs (public and private keys) for each user, securely storing private keys in encrypted storage on your device, using digital signatures to verify transaction authenticity, and providing backup options for your private keys protected by a password.

content.question: What happens if I lose access to my device?
content.answer: If you've created a backup of your private key in the Settings screen, you can restore your wallet on a new device using the backup and your password. Without a backup, you may lose access to your funds, so creating a secure backup is essential.

content.question: How do I sign out of Palma Wallet?
content.answer: You can sign out by either tapping the 'Sign Out' button in the header of the Home screen or by going to Settings > Account Actions > Sign Out. When you sign out, your wallet data is preserved locally to maintain access to your private keys and wallet information.

content.question: How is my private key stored in Palma Wallet?
content.answer: Your private key is stored securely using React Native's EncryptedStorage, which uses platform-specific encryption methods (Keychain on iOS and Keystore on Android). The private key never leaves your device unencrypted.

content.question: How do I back up my wallet?
content.answer: To back up your wallet: 1) Go to Settings, 2) Navigate to the 'Wallet Security' section, 3) Enter a strong password (minimum 8 characters), 4) Confirm your password, 5) Tap 'Secure Backup'. Store your backup password safely â€“ without it, you cannot restore your wallet.

content.question: What happens if I forget my backup password?
content.answer: If you forget your backup password, you won't be able to restore your wallet from the backup. There is no password recovery mechanism for security reasons. This is why it's crucial to store your backup password in a safe and memorable place.

content.question: How does transaction signing work in Palma Wallet?
content.answer: Palma Wallet uses cryptographic signing for all transactions. When you initiate a transaction, the app creates a digital signature using your private key. This signature proves you authorized the transaction without exposing your private key. The signature is verified on the blockchain using your public key.

content.question: Is my data synchronized across devices?
content.answer: Your basic account information is stored on Palma's servers, but your private keys remain only on your device for security. If you want to use your wallet on multiple devices, you need to use the backup and restore functionality on each device.

content.question: How do I send cryptocurrency with Palma Wallet?
content.answer: To send cryptocurrency: 1) Tap the 'Send' button on the Home screen, 2) Enter the recipient's wallet address or scan their QR code, 3) Enter the amount you want to send, 4) Select the network (ERC20 or TRC20), 5) Review the transaction details including fees, 6) Confirm to send. The transaction will be processed on the blockchain.

content.question: How do I receive cryptocurrency with Palma Wallet?
content.answer: To receive cryptocurrency: 1) Tap the 'Receive' button on the Home screen, 2) Your wallet address will be displayed along with a QR code, 3) Share this address with the sender, 4) Make sure the sender uses the correct network (ERC20 or TRC20), 5) Once the transaction is confirmed on the blockchain, the funds will appear in your wallet.

content.question: What's the difference between ERC20 and TRC20 networks?
content.answer: ERC20 is the token standard on the Ethereum blockchain, while TRC20 is the standard on the TRON blockchain. The main differences include: 1) Transaction fees - ERC20 typically has higher fees, 2) Confirmation time - TRC20 is usually faster, 3) Security aspects - ERC20 is considered more established. Always ensure the sender and receiver are using the same network.

content.question: How long do transactions take to complete?
content.answer: Transaction times vary by network: 1) ERC20 (Ethereum) transactions typically take between 30 seconds to several minutes, depending on network congestion and the gas fee paid, 2) TRC20 (TRON) transactions are usually faster, taking approximately 15-30 seconds. These times are for blockchain confirmations, not including time needed to prepare and sign transactions.

content.question: What are transaction fees and how do they work?
content.answer: Transaction fees are payments to blockchain network validators who process transactions. 1) For ERC20 (Ethereum), fees are called 'gas fees' and can vary significantly based on network congestion, 2) For TRC20 (TRON), fees are typically much lower and more stable. Palma Wallet displays the expected fee before you confirm a transaction, allowing you to make an informed decision.

content.question: What is the Swap feature in Palma Wallet?
content.answer: The Swap feature allows you to exchange one cryptocurrency for another directly within the Palma Wallet app. It provides an easy way to convert between digital assets without using an external exchange. This feature will be expanded in future updates to support more currency pairs and better rates.

content.question: My transaction is pending for a long time. What should I do?
content.answer: For long-pending transactions: 1) Check the network status - high congestion can delay processing, 2) For ERC20 transactions, the gas fee might be too low during high demand periods, 3) Verify your internet connection is stable, 4) Wait for blockchain confirmation - sometimes it takes longer during peak periods, 5) If the problem persists for more than a few hours, contact support with your transaction details.

content.question: I sent funds to the wrong address. Can I get them back?
content.answer: Unfortunately, blockchain transactions are irreversible once confirmed. If you sent funds to an incorrect address: 1) If you know the recipient, contact them directly to request a return transaction, 2) If you sent to an exchange or service, contact their customer support, 3) If you sent to a random address, recovery is generally not possible. Always double-check addresses before confirming transactions.

content.question: Why can't I see my balance after receiving a transaction?
content.answer: If your balance isn't updating: 1) Confirm the transaction has enough blockchain confirmations (check the explorer), 2) Verify you're checking the correct network (ERC20 vs TRC20), 3) Restart the app to refresh your balance, 4) Check if the sender has actually completed the transaction on their end, 5) If the transaction is confirmed on the blockchain but not showing in the app, contact support.

content.question: The app crashes when I try to send a transaction. What should I do?
content.answer: If the app crashes during transactions: 1) Update to the latest app version, 2) Restart your device, 3) Check your internet connection, 4) Make sure you have sufficient balance (including for transaction fees), 5) If the problem persists, try reinstalling the app (ensure you have your backup first!), 6) Contact support if none of these solutions work, providing details about your device and the circumstances of the crash.

content.question: What cryptographic methods does Palma Wallet use?
content.answer: Palma Wallet uses RSA cryptography in its initial version, transitioning to FIO Protocol library in newer versions. These cryptographic methods are used for generating key pairs, signing transactions, and verifying signatures. The implementation includes proper key generation, secure signing procedures, and robust verification methods to ensure transaction security.

content.question: How does Palma Wallet verify transaction signatures?
content.answer: Palma Wallet verifies signatures using public key cryptography: 1) When a transaction is created, a digital signature is generated using the sender's private key, 2) The signature, along with the transaction data, is sent to the server, 3) The server retrieves the user's public key from the database, 4) Using cryptographic verification algorithms, the server confirms that the signature is valid for the transaction data and could only have been created by the holder of the corresponding private key, without ever needing access to the private key itself.

content.question: What is the backend infrastructure for Palma Wallet?
content.answer: Palma Wallet uses AWS (Amazon Web Services) for its backend infrastructure. User data is stored in DynamoDB tables, with the region set to us-east-1 (Cape Town). The architecture includes serverless components with Lambda functions handling transaction processing and user data management. User private keys are never stored on the server - only public keys are stored to verify transaction signatures.

content.question: How does key generation work in Palma Wallet?
content.answer: Key generation in Palma Wallet has evolved with different versions: 1) Initial version used RSA cryptography with fallback mechanisms if RSA wasn't available, 2) Latest version uses FIO Protocol for key generation, where random bytes are generated as a seed, then processed through cryptographic functions to create a private key, from which a public key is derived. This approach ensures secure, collision-resistant key pairs unique to each user.

content.question: What new cryptocurrencies will be added to Palma Wallet?
content.answer: Palma Wallet plans to expand support beyond USDT to include major cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), and various stablecoins (USDC, DAI). The roadmap also includes support for popular tokens on both Ethereum and TRON networks.

content.question: Will Palma Wallet support hardware wallets?
content.answer: Yes, Palma Wallet is planning to add support for popular hardware wallets like Ledger and Trezor in a future update. This will allow users to connect their hardware wallets for additional security while still enjoying the user-friendly interface of Palma Wallet.

content.question: Is there a plan to add DeFi features to Palma Wallet?
content.answer: Yes, Palma Wallet has plans to introduce DeFi (Decentralized Finance) features in future updates. These will include staking, yield farming, and integration with popular DeFi protocols, allowing users to earn passive income on their crypto holdings directly from the wallet.

content.question: Will Palma Wallet support NFTs?
content.answer: Yes, support for viewing and managing NFTs (Non-Fungible Tokens) is on the Palma Wallet roadmap. This feature will allow users to view their NFT collections, receive NFTs, and eventually trade them directly within the app.

content.question: What is the Palma Wallet Swap feature?
content.answer: The Swap feature in Palma Wallet allows you to instantly exchange one cryptocurrency for another directly within the app. It integrates with Changelly, a trusted exchange service, to provide competitive rates and support for multiple cryptocurrency pairs. You can swap between USDT, USDC, ETH, BTC, and other supported cryptocurrencies without leaving the Palma Wallet app.

content.question: How do I swap cryptocurrencies in Palma Wallet?
content.answer: To swap cryptocurrencies: 1) Tap the 'Swap' button on the Home screen, 2) Select the cryptocurrency you want to swap from (e.g., USDT), 3) Select the cryptocurrency you want to receive (e.g., ETH), 4) Enter the amount you want to swap, 5) Review the exchange rate and fees displayed, 6) Confirm the swap details, 7) The transaction will be processed through Changelly's secure infrastructure. Your new cryptocurrency will appear in your wallet once the exchange is complete.

content.question: Which cryptocurrencies can I swap in Palma Wallet?
content.answer: Palma Wallet supports swapping between major cryptocurrencies including: 1) USDT (both ERC20 and TRC20), 2) USDC (ERC20), 3) Ethereum (ETH), 4) Bitcoin (BTC), and many other popular cryptocurrencies. The available trading pairs are continuously updated based on market availability through our integration with Changelly. You can check available pairs in the Swap interface.

content.question: What are the fees for swapping cryptocurrencies?
content.answer: Swap fees include: 1) Palma Wallet charges a 0.5% transaction fee on all swaps, 2) Changelly's exchange fee (typically 0.25-0.5%), 3) Network fees for the blockchain transactions (varies by network and congestion). The total fee is clearly displayed before you confirm the swap, so you know exactly what you'll pay. There are no hidden fees.

content.question: How long does a swap take to complete?
content.answer: Swap completion times depend on several factors: 1) Typical swaps take 5-30 minutes, 2) Bitcoin transactions may take longer (up to 60 minutes) due to network confirmations, 3) Ethereum and ERC20 token swaps usually complete within 5-15 minutes, 4) TRC20 swaps are typically faster (3-10 minutes). You can track your swap status in real-time within the app.

content.question: What is the minimum and maximum amount I can swap?
content.answer: Swap limits vary by cryptocurrency: 1) Minimum amounts are set by Changelly and typically range from $10-50 USD equivalent, 2) Maximum amounts can go up to $50,000 USD equivalent per transaction for verified users, 3) Daily limits may apply based on your account verification level. The exact limits for your selected pair are shown in the Swap interface before you confirm the transaction.

content.question: Can I cancel a swap after initiating it?
content.answer: Once a swap is confirmed and submitted to the blockchain, it cannot be cancelled due to the irreversible nature of blockchain transactions. However: 1) You can cancel before final confirmation in the app, 2) If a swap fails due to network issues, your original funds will be returned, 3) Always double-check amounts and addresses before confirming. Contact support if you experience any issues with a swap.

content.question: Why is my swap taking longer than expected?
content.answer: Swaps may take longer due to: 1) High network congestion on the blockchain, 2) Additional confirmations required for large amounts, 3) Temporary delays at Changelly's processing end, 4) Network maintenance or upgrades. If your swap hasn't completed within 2 hours, contact support with your swap ID. You can always track your swap status in the transaction history.

content.question: What is the Fiat On-Ramp feature in Palma Wallet?
content.answer: The Fiat On-Ramp feature allows you to buy cryptocurrency directly with your local currency (like USD, EUR, NGN, etc.) using various payment methods. Palma Wallet partners with multiple payment providers including MoonPay, Mercuryo, and others through Changelly's infrastructure to offer competitive rates and wide geographic coverage, especially focused on African markets.

content.question: How do I buy cryptocurrency with fiat currency?
content.answer: To buy cryptocurrency: 1) Tap the 'Buy' button on the Home screen, 2) Select your country (auto-detected by default), 3) Choose how much you want to spend in your local currency, 4) Select your preferred payment provider from the available options, 5) Review the amount of cryptocurrency you'll receive and fees, 6) Tap 'Buy Now' to proceed to the provider's secure checkout, 7) Complete payment on the provider's website, 8) Cryptocurrency will be deposited to your Palma Wallet automatically.

content.question: Which payment methods are supported?
content.answer: Supported payment methods vary by country and provider but typically include: 1) Credit/Debit cards (Visa, Mastercard), 2) Bank transfers (ACH, SEPA, Wire), 3) Mobile money (M-PESA, Airtel Money in supported regions), 4) Digital wallets (Apple Pay, Google Pay), 5) Local payment methods specific to your country. Available methods are shown when you select a provider.

content.question: What are the fees for buying cryptocurrency?
content.answer: Fees for buying cryptocurrency include: 1) Provider fees (typically 1-4% depending on payment method), 2) Network fees for depositing crypto to your wallet, 3) Payment processing fees (may apply for certain methods). Palma Wallet doesn't charge additional fees on top of the provider's rates. All fees are transparently displayed before you confirm your purchase.

content.question: Which countries are supported for buying crypto?
content.answer: Palma Wallet's fiat on-ramp supports over 150 countries with special focus on African markets including: Nigeria, Kenya, South Africa, Ghana, Uganda, Tanzania, and many others. The available payment providers and methods depend on your location. When you open the Buy feature, it automatically detects your country and shows available options. Some providers may require specific documentation based on local regulations.

content.question: What are the purchase limits for buying crypto?
content.answer: Purchase limits vary by provider and country: 1) Minimum purchase is typically $10-50 USD equivalent, 2) Maximum limits range from $500-$10,000 per transaction for new users, 3) Daily/monthly limits may apply based on verification level, 4) Higher limits available after completing KYC verification with the provider. Exact limits are shown for each provider before you proceed.

content.question: How long does it take to receive purchased cryptocurrency?
content.answer: Purchase completion times vary by payment method: 1) Card payments: Usually 10-30 minutes, 2) Bank transfers: 1-5 business days depending on your bank, 3) Mobile money: Typically within 30 minutes, 4) Digital wallets: Usually instant to 15 minutes. After payment is confirmed by the provider, cryptocurrency delivery to your Palma Wallet is typically within minutes.

content.question: Do I need to verify my identity to buy cryptocurrency?
content.answer: Identity verification requirements depend on: 1) The payment provider you choose, 2) Your purchase amount, 3) Your country's regulations. Small purchases (under $150) often don't require verification. Larger amounts typically require: 1) Email verification, 2) Phone number confirmation, 3) Government ID upload, 4) Selfie verification. Each provider's requirements are shown before you proceed.

content.question: What should I do if my purchase fails?
content.answer: If your purchase fails: 1) Check if your payment was declined by your bank/card issuer, 2) Ensure you've entered correct payment details, 3) Verify your purchase doesn't exceed limits, 4) Try a different payment method or provider, 5) If payment was taken but crypto wasn't received, save your order ID and contact the provider's support directly, 6) Palma Wallet support can also help track your order status.

content.question: Can I sell cryptocurrency for fiat currency (Off-Ramp)?
content.answer: Currently, Palma Wallet focuses on helping users buy cryptocurrency (on-ramp). The sell feature (off-ramp) is planned for future release and will allow you to: 1) Sell crypto for local currency, 2) Withdraw to bank accounts, 3) Use mobile money cashout in supported regions, 4) Access local exchange partners. Check the app for updates on when this feature becomes available in your region.

content.question: Why are different providers shown for different countries?
content.answer: Payment providers have different geographic coverage based on: 1) Local regulatory compliance and licenses, 2) Banking partnerships in each country, 3) Available payment infrastructure, 4) Local currency support. Palma Wallet automatically shows providers that work best in your location, ensuring you get reliable service and competitive rates for your specific country.

content.question: Is buying cryptocurrency through Palma Wallet safe?
content.answer: Yes, buying crypto through Palma Wallet is safe because: 1) We only partner with licensed and regulated payment providers, 2) All transactions use secure encryption, 3) Payment processing happens on the provider's secure platform, 4) Your Palma Wallet address is automatically provided to ensure correct delivery, 5) We monitor all purchases for successful completion. Always verify you're on the correct provider website when making payment.
